intro: Gonolobus dasytrichus, commonly known as the hairy leaf morning glory, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is characterized by its distinctive hairy leaves and trumpet-shaped flowers that bloom in the morning. The plant belongs to the Convolvulaceae family, which includes many other morning glories. It typically grows as a climbing vine with tendrils that help it ascend supports. Its botanical features make it a popular ornamental plant in gardens and greenhouses.
